isis.stitle: TSI 93-04-02 - Information Concerning Fluoroelastomers (FKM) - VITON, FLUOREL, AFLAS

subjectgroup.subject: Information Concerning Fluoroelastomers (FKM) - VITON, FLUOREL, AFLAS

geninfo.para: Navistar is using Fluoroelastomers (FKM) in O-rings, gaskets and seals in power train and air brake applications requiring high-temperature performance and fluid resistance. More applications are being added everyday as customers' requirements are demanding longer life parts with lower service requirements. Navistar recently released a new heavy duty wheel seal utilizing FKM that will far outlast any existing wheel seal.

FKM is a premium material both in performance and cost. Component design requirements are carefully studied to assure that the correct material is specified for a given application. When used under design conditions, FKM is safe and justified. However, if exposed to temperatures of 600°F (316°C) or greater, FKM may decompose and the formation of hydrofluoric acid (HF) may occur. HF can be highly corrosive to human tissue if not handled properly. Navistar application of fluoroelastomers do not result in exposure to temperatures of 600°F (316°C) or higher in operation or service.

FKM is often a brown rubber in O-rings and seals to differentiate it from other materials, but it can be any color, including black. HF WILL APPEAR AS A CLEAR LIQUID ON OR ADJACENT TO THE RUBBER MATERIAL.The following precautions should be followed when handling FKM parts suspected of being contaminated with HF.

warning.para: WARNING WHEN HANDLING FKM PARTS EXPOSED TO EXCESSIVELY HIGH TEMPERATURES

DO NOT TOUCH EITHER THE SEAL OR SURROUNDING EQUIPMENT WITHOUT WEARING NEOPRENE OR PVC GLOVES IF DECOMPOSITION OR THE PRESENCE OF HF IS SUSPECTED. A decomposed seal may appear as charred or a black sticky mass. HF may condense as a clear liquid on the part or equipment. ALLOW THE EQUIPMENT TO COOL. Then wear neoprene or heavy PVC gloves to safely handle parts or equipment. Wash parts and equipment well with 10 percent limewater (calcium hydroxide solution) to neutralize any hydrogen fluoride. Discard gloves after handling decomposed FKM parts.

geninfo.para: FIRST AID:Wash affected areas of the skin IMMEDIATELYwith plenty of water. Then rub a 2.5% calcium gluconate gel into skin until there is no further irritation. SEEK PROMPT MEDICAL ATTENTION.Tell the doctor that a hydrogen fluoride (HF or hydrofluoric acid) burn is suspected.
FKM's used in Navistar products are safe in the normal service environment.
